name: MARK Simpson
text: Now more than ever we all need to know we can still depend on somebody !! A Mr. Lopez was sent by my insurance company to pick up my Cherokee. I'll keep his number with me from now on. Professional as they come. Was polite and friendly the whole time. Never stop working and got it from point A to point B done right.

name: Jerod Nolen
text: On this day my experience with the driver Mr. Lopez was excellent, and outstanding!!! Mr. Lopez showed great customer service, and did his job well!!! He got me to my location, and made sure that I was please, and very satisfied overall!!! I recommend that you use him and this service when needed.

name: Angie Fields
text: I will use Prestige for all of my towing needs! I had a truck that needed towed and Reggie worked me into his schedule as quick as he could. He definitely was cheaper than all competitors in the area and got my truck to it’s location without any problems! Thanks Reggie for your service!

resp.text: thanks for your review Angie, appreciated!

name: Jared Dickey
text: Super fast and friendly service / great price. Cant remember the guys name but he had a full head of dreadlocks and a winning personality. 10/10 would use again

name: Willie Sullivan
text: If you are looking for a fast, reliable and professional towing service Prestige Automotive Solutions LLC is the right company. I was really impressed with their work!

name: Melissa Horn
text: After waiting for over an hour to get my car towed, I found out from my insurance company that these guys decided not to come because the road was blocked. They didnt want to drive another 10 minutes to go around the blocked part of the road. So they just decided not to come. I was alone on the side of the road, in the dark, and rain. Will never use these guys for assistance again.

name: Sarah Jane Dawson
text: Great service! The owner of the company (I believe his name was Dennis) was very nice and helpful. Quality service, please give him your business!

name: Kerrie Crawford
text: Nice gentleman!! Great value!! No problems!! We will call again when and if needed!! Thank You!! You saved us!!

name: Andrew Godfrey
text: Man. DJ just left our place. I fully expected the driver to come on site and say, "No. We can't do that." This dude moved his truck a half dozen times getting our piece of equipment un-stuck from where it was. No damage. Super friendly guy. Very profesional. Awesome in every way. Would definitely recommend.

name: Amanda Lee
text: Excellent service! I will definitely use again in the future if needed,!

name: Melissa Cook
text: My family and I had need a tow and we came in contact with this driver named Daniel, Hub City you have a great employee. He came in a timely manner and had a great personality. Bottom line he did a great job. I would highly recommend you to ask for Daniel.

name: Patrick Ballou
text: My vehicle broke down a mile from their storefront and I only needed towed half a mile to my house. Ended up waiting just under 4 hours while being told "it'll be 30 minutes" over and over again as I made repeated calls to see what was taking so long. Plus it was nearly 90 bucks. One of the worst experiences I've ever had with any business in my life.

name: Clarke Stewart
text: Other than a 5% charge to use your credit card and an attitude when you request a roll back instead of a wheel lift, the service was acceptable.

name: Richie Beard
text: I did not use this service bychoice. My car so towed from a parking place in Orange beach when I was told by the hotel security that I could park there !!! .

name: Jeanette
text: Bad for business! DO NOT DO BUSINESS WITH THESE GUYS! They don't want to be bothered. Wrong equipment for the job that needs to be done.

name: masjidbaitulhaqq
text: They were the only company to answer the phone on Sunday

name: Tonia Saunders
text: I had a gas leak on my car. My apartment manager called these people to tow it. I specifically asked if he would tow it to my mechanic. He said no. It would have only cost me $125 to do this. So he took it to their yard. It cost me $310 to get my car out. The girl at hub city told me they told him they would let him tow it to my mechanic for $125. I had another tow company that would come to my apartment and he was only going to charge me $45. Huh City are thiefs!!!!!! I'm so angry!!!

name: Robert Jackson
text: Despite the busy workload my experience with hub city has always been good. The drivers are normally always friendly.

name: Destiny Michelle
text: Terrible service. Waited an hour on the side of the highway for them just to call and find out that they were not coming and cancelled the call because we have an all wheel drive vehicle. They failed to let us know that they were not coming and never called.

name: Eric Piaskowski
text:
My experience was good.  I had to wait on the side of the freeway with my dad’s car after he had a tire blowout on the way to work.

Joseph was great 👍  He was really courteous and helpful, and he got the job done.  He helped us out majorly and we appreciate it.

Eric P. in Theodore, AL

name: Claude Franklin
text: Horrible experience

name: Tracey Knight
text: Waited three hours for a tow. Not reliable at all. Call someone else if you want to get quick service.

name: Blake Bollinger
text:
Absolutely horrific experience!
My wife was at a conference in Mobile and was in my car and it wouldn't start. So I called AAA and had them send someone out. They said it'd be 50 minutes at the longest. Keep in mind she's at a conference in and out of classes the whole time so she can't really be ducking in and out. Plus she was supposed to be leaving the next day so we really needed to get my car to a shop ASAP to start seeing what was wrong with it.
She arranged it so she could be waiting for the guy when he was supposed to get there. After an hour they don't show so I called AAA, they called the towing company and said it'd be 10-15 minutes. After 30 minutes still nothing.
I called back, they called the towing company again, oh they're 10 minutes away. 30 minutes later nothing.
I called again and AAA said it showed on their screen that the guy had arrived (nope). So they said that usually means he's in the area. She waited out by the car (105 degree heat index) for 15 more minutes before the guy finally showed.
So it took them 2.5 hours to get there when they said it would only take 50 minutes.
Then she said the guy just wanted to chit chat the whole time, never once made an excuse for why they were so late or anything. She kept telling him she needed to go back to her classes but the guy just kept chatting her up.
Absolutely miserable experience. If you call AAA and these people are who they're sending, just pay whatever you have to, to use another company.

name: patricia garnett
text: 1 Star simply because I cannot give them 0. I have attempted to use them twice-only for them to have me waiting so long I had to call a separate tow company each time. Not to mention how laughably rude the secretary was. I was looking to see if they had a positive review on here and it was created by a guy that works there LOL so be careful with these guys. Take advice from a local and PLEASE call Semmes Towing and save yourself some time.

name: Larry Price
text: I work for hub city. They are the best company I've ever worked for. Love making customers smile/ happy when I help them out. Highly recommend tow company!

name: Alex Gonzalez
text: Blew a tire on I-10 near downtown mobile, GEICO handed me over to Hub City Towing and they were there an hour before the provided ETA. Friendly, professional employee gave me an honest assessment of the situation when we arrived at a local shop. He clearly knew what he was doing and efficiency goes a long way when it comes to emergency automotive/ mechanical services. Highly recommend Hub City.

name: Kyle Oberhart
text: We needed a tow at 11 AM it’s 3:30 and still no show this is a terrible company and have called them three times each time they say only twenty more minutes before getting here. Ridiculous.

name: Chelsea Ricca
text: I think his name was Henry ( I suck with names but he had brown hair and a goatee) was absolutely a life saver! He did everything in his power to make us comfortable, and even offered a ride home! I am literally so grateful to him for being so prompt and generous with his time and efforts. Thanks again <3

name: Prisca Bradley
text: Scott Evans was by far the best tow truck driver. Awesome customer service and cool as a fan. Thanks hub city

name: Molly Schmidt
text: Thank you so much hub city! Our car broke down in Mobile while driving from Texas to Florida. We needed 2 tows- and Both Chase & John were amazing and saved the day! Thanks for your superior service & going above & beyond! :)

name: Diana Duffield
text:
The last thing you want on vacation is 2 damaged tires!!!!

The personalized service we received from Nathan was outstanding. What a professional and friendly driver and resource he was for us!!  Thanks, Nathan.  Chuck and Diana

name: Whitney Jaillet
text: Called AAA for a dead battery and they sent a contractor from Hub City towing. He was very nice, and got my car up and running in under an hour from the time I placed the original call. It was an easy and stress free experience.

name: Mark Thomas
text: Brian the driver of the tow truck very  courteous and professional he strap my car down securely and after watching him pull the car up he was very careful so overall I’m very happy with Brian and hub city towing. Thanks

name: Akennya Barnes
text: These guys came quick and they were super nice! This was exactly what I needed after having such a terrible and upsetting experience another local tow company.

name: Richard Junkins Jr
text:
I was wary to use them based on some negative reviews, but the driver was very prompt and courteous. I thought I had a bad starter in my truck but Mike was able to get me jumped off and even offered to still tow if I wasn’t comfortable driving myself.
My experience was very positive and hopefully I won’t need them in the future. If so, I’ll call them again.

name: Julie Roden
text: Quoted an eta of an hour. Called after an hour an a half, was told they were right there and were on their way. Another half hour goes by, I called again and was told the same thing. They said they were right up the road about to be there. Another half hour went by and I called my insurance company who called them to begin with. Statefarm called them and were told the exact same thing they told me, up the road about to be there. Finally 10 minutes after the insurance company called they showed up. No explanation or apology. I understand things can get busy and backed up, but if you know it's going to be 3 hours don't quote me 1. And if he's not actually "right up the road on his way" don't tell me he is 3 times. If your insurance company tells you Hun City is the towing company coming for you, call them back and tell them you want someone else. Took three hour to get a tow.

name: Cathy Lowery
text: Working through AAA, I was routed to Hub City. Ray came out to help me out a stupid jam. I'd managed to get my car stuck in my own backyard after heavy rains. He was fast, kind and professional! I was so impressed and will stick with Hub City! Thanks Ray!

name: Marti Thornton
text: I have never had to wait so long for a tow and knowing i was broke down with a child in the side of the Rd while i didn't want to hold my sister up for the 2 hour wait they said they had one truck running that area. I tried backing out but due to insurance involved i had to wait. Never again! Destination towing was a quarter of the price and much less wait.

name: Kandice Enzor
text: The one star is the lowest so that will have to do. The driver was super nice. Geigo was amazing. The "boss" Renee at hub city was horriable. Message for details. Was going to have my car on the side of the road for a few miles from drop off untill geico stwped in. What kind of buisness does this.

name: Dwayne miller
text: Brian was my driver very fast ,nice guy, professional. Had to wait a little while but they did say they were busy

name: Tamara Shirley
text: This is the worse company ever to exist, I called AAA and  Hub City sent a totally idiot who knew knowing but how to lie and have a smart mouth, he told me after I waited 30 minutes, that he could not tow my car, that they dispatched him to another call, AAA called back and said , the driver said I didn't have the title, which was a total lie, I had it in my hand, VERY RUDE COMPANY ONLY GOOD THING IS ,  I WILL NEVER USE AGAIN, THERE ARE PLENTY OF OTHER COMPANIES,  if I could give  lower rating I would

name: Samantha Pickney
text: This company is horrible. I was told they were coming to tow by 12. I been waiting two hours. I had my kids with me. They kept lying about how long it was gonna be. It is very hot outside. When I called they put me on hold right away and didn't care. This shows how horrible this company is. My kids are 4 and 2. They were waiting in the heat at noon time. Now it's almost 1.

name: Jash Yotes
text:
Need a tow, un-jumpable car dead in the driveway.

Driver was an hour late, acted weird the entire time he was around my wife, and locked the keys in the car after he dropped it at the mechanic shop. The closest set of back-up keys are in Mobile, I live in Gulf Shores - so we needed someone to unlock it.

I called Hub City, who apologized & said they had a car in the same area as the mechanic shop that could get it unlocked. An hour and a half later - car is still locked in the lot.

I call Hub City to ask where their "local car" was & had the most absurd conversation with the dispatcher woman. She REFUSED to let me speak to anyone else & continued to push responsibility to anyone but her driver. (In absolutely idiotic ways)

At one point she quite literally accused my insurance company of being the folks at fault for locking the keys in the car. A few choice quotes:
_________________________________
"We don't provide car unlocking services, I don't know who told you someone was on the way, they were wrong."

"You told him to leave the keys in the car,"  I didn't. "Your wife did, then" No she didn't. "Someone did." No they didn't. "I know someone did." How do you know this? "I just know."

"How do you know there was someone at the counter at the shop? Maybe he didn't have anyone to give the keys to."

________________________________________

so on so forth.

Because of the lost time, the mechanic shop might have to keep my car over the weekend instead of identifying the problem Thurs. & having parts to the store Friday morning.

Save yourself the headache if you have a choice - choose ANYONE but Hub City. These are not competent people. They do not have their acts together.

name: Lori Dorlet
text: Had truck towed to my house by Greg. Awesome guy! Cute too :)

name: Vicki U
text:
Damaged our vehicle and refused to accept responsibility. AVOID.

I am shocked and appalled that AAA uses this company given the bad reviews and our experience. We're long-time AAA members and will be reconsidering that as well.

name: Disco Dingo, LLC
text: My car broke down at Cammie's Old Dutch Ice Cream (best ice cream ever) in Mid-Town after dark this weekend. State Farm said Hub City Towing would arrive in an hour to take my car to Griffith Service Station (best mechanics ever). Alas, there was no alternative than to pass the time with a second scoop of ice cream; thus, I relented. :-) Anyway, Hub City Towing arrived in about 20 minutes, not the hour that State Farm suggested, so that was a pleasant surprise. He loaded my car, delivered it to my mechanic, then dropped me off at my house which is about a mile from the service station. It was no mind blowing experience, but I give them five stars because the driver exceeded my expectations and insisted on dropping me off so that I would get home safely. Works for me. Cheers, LJ

name: Brian Hall
text: Way too expensive. They wanted to charge me $125 from Grand Bay to Mobile where everyone else charges $75. Not too friendly also.

name: Summer Stanford
text: Hub City is a very good company they are very respectful quick response very professional

name: Scarlett Smith
text: Very rude and lied over the phone....

name: Reyner Rodriguez
text: Driving up Airport towards Schillinger. Saw a Hub  City Towing truck, towing a mini van. It was at night and his lights were flashing strongly. Due to a migraine headache I decided to pass the Hub City Towing truck by passing and getting in font of the driver. The idiot who was driving the Hub City towing truck got mad, hit the gas and drove around me, passing me hauling ass driving 70 mph, all while towing some customers vehicle. We both came to a red light and because of his unprofessional and crazy driving I pulled my window down to ask him why he's driving so fast. His wife/gf or co-worker, pulled her window down and his answer was because I cut in front of him. I told him his lights were bothering me and I needed to pass him. Explained to him that him towing a vehicle and driving 70mph was dangerous and unprofessional from a towing company. Wouldn't recommend anyone to call Hub City Towing for towing services, not unless you want a crazy person racing up Airport Blvd with your most likely damaged or personal vehicle.

name: Micaela Weldon
text: Worst company ever don't call them. Called at 9:30am and its after 1:30 and they still haven't showed up. Saw two tow trucks passed me that wasn't towing any cars.I called back to complain they said they'll get here when they can. Even suggested I could leave my car and come back when they call. That's stupid if this my my only car. Called my insurance company to switch company and they came right on. I wouldn't give them one star. Worst company ever!

name: Adam Hannah
text: A bunch of damn thieves. They had my truck impounded for several weeks. When I got it back there were hundreds of dollars of tools and material gone. They do not follow procedure. Absolutely the worst wrecker service on the gulf coast

name: Brandon Drago
text: I had my car towed May 24th. Told hub city that my tire was busted and my oil pan. Which means you can't crank it! When the tow lady picked my car up she cranked it twice.! She said nobody told her to not crank it. She just thought I had a busted tire! Why would I have my car towed to a mechanic for a busted tire!!!!!!!!! To top it off she didn't leave a receipt which I had to go get and she was laughing about it! Waiting now to see if cars engine is messed up from being cranked! If so hub city will be buying me another car!!!!!!! Very unprofessional! Will never use again and will tell everybody I know about the incident!

name: John Wayne Dilling
text: You know the reason I don't believe these rating sies is ou don't know if its true or the person was just bitter or having a bad day and going to take it out on who ever they can! I use to drive for hub city and use to get calls that I was driving reckless and speeding etc. Well this company has gps tracking system that will let them review the speed at the time and on tube road that the complaint was on. So to theguy that said the driver was driving 70 mph on airport blvd that's probably BS if he called it in the dispatcher would look on the screen in  front of him and the truck in question would have been busted he could back it up till the truck was in the location and how fast he was going and even if the g forces were accesive like driving wreckless and I know most complaints called in are proven false just a case of someone being passed off at the world and got caught behind a tow truck and decided heads were going to role!

name: Mark Neil
text: No truck available/driver for night time breakdown. They should be out of business, if you are supporting a international city.

name: Sami Snyder
text:
Sent to us by AAA. Arrived on time. Very friendly guy.
There are some bad reviews on here, but our experience was great.

name: Amber Turberville
text: These people are a joke, especially to work for , they don't train properly and they show favortism ,I was excited to work for them until I actually worked for them ,and not to mention they're very rude to their customers, don't waste your time with them.

name: Scott Griffith
text: One hour to one hour and a half  is what they said the wait would be and yet it is over two hours, Called and they said 15 to 20 minutes. That was 45 minutes ago and no tow truck. Not cool Hub City.

name: Mark Byrd
text: Nice trucks

name: Bama Racer
text: Don't call these people unless you have hours to wait.  They will say an hour to an hour and a half but it will be longer more around 2-3 hours.  And they act like it's a problem to come pick you up.  Not to mention the lady that answers the phone will lie about the situation the whole time.

name: MsGrimes2011
text: I called a tow truck b/c my car was leaking transmission fluid really badly & I was scared to drive it. My insurance paid for the tow. The guy showed up a few hours later to pick my car up. I had went back to work b/c I was getting it checked out on my lunch break. I had left my keys in my middle console for the driver. Everything happened so unexpectedly that I didn't realize that my GPS was still in the middle console. Needless to say, the tow truck driver stole my GPS. Lesson learned. Never trust people to do the right thing.

name: Casey Jones
text: The worse company I have ever dealt with, I had my 2 little boys in the car and the car wouldn't start, I called and was told it would be half a hour, it was 2 hours later and the employees were so rude, like its ok to not call me, when they were late, and I should be happy that they even showed up

name: Brian Mizell
text: Great service

name: Victoria Holloway
text: This is a terrible place! They made me wait three hours for a tow two days in a row, and on the second day didn't have any of my information. So when they dropped it off at the shop, they weren't even able to tell them who's car it was. Understaffed and unprofessional

name: Kane1
text: Had to wait 1 hour and 45 minutes before my insurance company called this company back to see where was the driver they claim they never got a service request for a tow and it will be another hour before you be able to send out a driver. So my insurance company cancel that request an got Alabama Auto Center to come. They were there in 25 mins.

name: Donna P
text: Customer horrible. Representatives are rude and they will cancel service if you call them out on their carp. I wish insurance companies  would not use them as their primary provider. They are very prejudice.

name: Danarius Dixon
text: had to wait 5 freaking hours for a tow truck everytime I called the office they lied  I wouldn't recommend this company to anybody

name: M Tamimi
text: Not professional and very low attitude people.

name: James Holcombe
text: Very professional.

name: Mary Smith
text: 7 hours later, no tow.

name: Scarlet Vizier
text: Broke down in Mobile, AL on the side the interstate while evacuating from Louisiana for Hurricane Ida. Called Hub City and they got to us in a very short amount of time. They waited for a taxi to pick us up on the side the interstate and was very helpful the next day in towing our vehicle to the repair shop. Would recommend. Also the dispatcher was very nice with excellence service!

name: Jon Billingsley
text: I've have had several calls to Hare Wrecker Service to tow some buildings for me. I will not call any one else. They are the best company I have ever dealt with. Thx's Hare Wrecker!!

name: scott harris
text: Showed up when scheduled did the job for good price. Friendly driver

name: David Johnson
text: Very fast and reliable.

name: Andrew Edwards
text: The owners are awesome. Chris is the best. Andrea is very helpful. Been using them for 5 yrs now wouldn't think of trusting my vehicle with anyone else.

name: Stacey Gray
text: Hare Wrecker is awesome!  They have been very helpful to my family and friends on several occasions.  They are professional, efficient, and quick to respond.  They were quick to help my dad when his car broke down.  They not only took care of his car, but made sure to check on my dad afterwards.  Thanks Hare Wrecker for being a business that cares about its customers!!

name: daniel barnett
text: Quick a reliable

name: Stix N stones
text: Awesome speedy service really friendly and very helpful driver.

name: Jeff Word
text: This is a family owned and ran business.  They treat people with fairness and respect. They are quick to respond and they are knowledgeable in doing their job. 45 years in business speaks volumes.  Wouldn't use anyone else .

name: Anne Harrison
text: Family owned business that is professional, kind, helpful, fair and a pleasure to do business with. Highly recommended.

name: Mark Raper
text: Lost my ride nothing more to say

name: Leeanne Dove
text: Very good company and will help you in anyway!

name: Wendy Uhlman
text: Great customer service....

name: Sammy Mccurry
text: I have known this family a long time & they have always treated everyone super great.I HIGHLY RECOMEND HARE WRECKER TOO EVERYONE.

name: Linda Richmond
text: Hare Wrecker Service have always been professional and friendly. They have always been there for me every time I have ever needed them.

name: Joseph Albright
text: Very friendly staff. Great service and rates.

name: Jason Guyton
text: Great service and professional.

name: Pamela B Alexander
text: We have used Hare Wrecker Service since 1984. Good honest people.

name: Tony Pearson
text: Great Service!

name: Lindsey Westcott
text: They were rude to me and charged for two days storage even though it was less than 24 hrs.

name: Heath Blair
text: Good folks, professional business.

name: Carlie Lentz
text: Wonderful people!!

name: Jayme Kelton
text: Good people

name: Craig Bowman
text: Awesome service

name: Jonathan Hamlin
text: Friendly and professional.

name: John Iftodi
text: Good Service!!!

name: Michelle Vincent
text: Honestly the bad reviews are from bitter people. Yes my car was repoed nobody fault but my own. I called Monday morning after a Friday repo. The lady was so nice and even gave me a bible scripture. I was able to get my car Monday morning before it was even processed. Reviews are good but go on your own personal experience...even in a bad situation, it was not so bad💯

name: lisa blue
text: OMG I HAD TO DRIVE TO CARBIN HILLS. I was so nervous, it was an hour and a half from my place of living and employment.  I could not believe Credit Accept... sent my car (Becky), so far away. I had to remember that the company Credit Acceptance is LOCATED in Michigan.  24/7 was in the unknown land. I had to pay a 50.00 fee, I asked the woman what the fee I had incurred, she said ADMINISTRATIVE FEE. REALLY.  TAKING my belongings from my car, throwing them in a trash bag. Throwing out all my expensive chemical and washer fluid and other items, my YETI CUP, ok I was very polite I just wanted to get the hell out of there.  How the f,,,, do a company strip ur car of it's belongingand send ur car away. Like really. I blame Credit Acc., so the  big woman in the chair says we will get ur belongs wait in ur car. U don't say that to me it was 99 degrees lady. Guesswhat they had my TAG, LEAVE THE F,,, TAG ON THE CAR. DONT PLAY... CRED ACCEPT. how dare u. Have one company strip acar take all the change and dollars and any expensive things they want. In a matter of 24hours. Credit Acceptance should be shame, this is a CLASS ACTION LAWSUIT. I AM an essential worker, an a child of mine experienced Cov.19. No mercy.  Now I must pay an extra 20.00$. A month on a car that I had to have detailed, because so many people touched my car. God got me tho.  Dont ever think u giants beat us..Because its called class action.  Let's all take and reflect, Alabama is has no lemon laws or shall I say us as consumers vs company's don't matter.  In regard the big lady was just following orders, and she was sweet.  So I give her 5 stars. For being polite and sweet. Blue a proud US AIRFORCE VETERAN,  dealing my Cred. ACCEPT.

name: Josie Fields
text: I will not even give this place one star. They are terrible. My car was repossessed sometime between Friday night and Saturday morning which I realize as I am getting ready to leave for work on Saturday morning, I am a healthcare worker by the way. So I call finance company which is a whole other story. My car was never supposed to have been picked up to start with. But they send release for my car. So I immediately call 24/7 recovery to get my car. No answer called for hours with no response to messages or emails. So finally drive to carbon hill and hour from me. No one is there. There were two more numbers on the sign repeatedly call them no answer or straight to voicemail with no response to messages. Finally contact several other recovery companys in carbon hill even reach out to the police because by now I have walked the property and my car is no where to be found. Find out that 24/7 has a holding lot in hueytown which is where I just drove from. Go back home and call again all day Sunday with once again no response. Now here it is Monday morning I have called they now say they have no release for my car so call bank they had to send it twice because first time recovery says they did not receive it. So now 24/7 hasn't release but surprise I still can't have my car. Because we are under a state of emergency for "POTENTIAL" winter weather. POTENTIAL! So I am told I can't get my car until Thursday. Ok so can I have my stuff because I have to work and all my equipment is in my car. Now they can go to work and I'm sure go tow wrecked cars but they can not unlock the lot where my car is so that me a essential healthcare worker can either get my things for work or my car. This is total BS.  I  am gonna go ahead and apologize on their behalf if you have to deal with these people because they are terrible. And I called govenor ivy office to inform them how their essential workers are being treated.

name: Scotty Woods
text: Awesome job at a very fair price

name: Vic Rogers
text: They towed my car from Birmingham to carbon Hill, took everything out of my car and took my car tag, left all that in carbon Hill turn my car to Birmingham to the auto auction and I have to drive all the way back to carbon Hill to get my car tag to drive my car home. And everyone associated with 24/7 towing has been quite unhelpful, nobody will answer the phone, or call me back. When I did get to my on the phone the first person hung up on me and the second wasnt wasnt helpful.  They are the worst tow company around

name: Mary Carter
text: Awesome customer service

name: Hollywood Nat
text: So I am seriously never the type of person that write reviews; however my experience with this company has been beyond horrible. The get zero stars from me. My car was towed and I was told that it was taken to Twenty Four Seven Recovery. So lets start on 01/15/2020 I called around 9 AM maybe 10 am to set up an appointment (because as you know if you call the number that they provide for you you have to set up an appointment because they have many different locations.) So I did just that. My appointment was set for 01/23/2020 (A WEEK LATER) from 3-4. So of course I has to leave work at 2 in order to get my things out my car because Carbon Hill is 1 hr away from where I'm located. I get there and I overhear one of the ladies say that the car has been there for 8 days ( which makes no sense that means the car would've been there when I set up the appointment.) So the lady that was assisting me tells me because they did not have the key to my trunk they couldn't get the stuff out of there and my car is in Hueytown which of course I can't make because they stop taking appointments at 330 and it was 315 before I even got to Carbon Hill. So I asked her ya'll didn't think to call me and she responds oh we just found out like right now. LIKE HOW???????????????????????????????????????????? Do ya'll not have notifications for appointments? So I wasted money because I had to put gas in my car and I wasted time that I will NEVER get back. All it took was for them to call me. I'm being ripped off  it was his lucky day I gave him a pass because I dont let fat boys run there mouth at me ,he must be used to talking to others like that. just beware if you call Hanks towing be ready to empty your wallet to them and that administration fee on top of towing I dont understand that ha! ha! That's a good one ,you got me this time but never again

resp.text:
Mr. Pilgrim,
All of our pricing, No matter the jurisdiction involved, Are equal in all amounts and are within regulation(s) of the state of Alabama and all local municipalities.
The administrative or "Admin" fee that is charged reflects the costs we have to pay to search within the Alabama Department of Revenue and if applicable, any other state in which the vehicle is registered, to obtain the names of the registered owner and or lienholders (If applicable) on any vehicle pulled in, Reason being as so we don't get someone coming in with a handwritten bill of sale for example, stating that they are the owner of whatever vehicle they may see in our lot is theirs, It's a safeguard measure we take to keep any customers property secure, And to ensure only the rightful owner of the vehicle is allowed to even touch it.
Your invoice copies will reflect that our storage charges are $30 per day, Which added in to your total price accrued of $360, And paid in full.
My apologies on having to meet on social media as a platform for resolution.
Please don't hesitate to contact us for any future towing needs, We'd be glad to amicably assist you in any way we can.

name: Brian Anthony
text:
I didn't use Hank's in the conventional sense, But my insurance (progressive) sent a driver out to my home to pick up my deer damaged vehicle and take it to Birmingham for Progressive to look at.
Your driver was Joey, And I haven't had a better experience with anyone during this period than he was. The tow truck the police called out to pick my truck were nice and quick, But when they asked where I wanted them to take it to, they seemed a little bit annoyed that I wanted it to go to my home, as I wanted to talk with my insurance agent first. I suppose they prefer taking them to their place or a body shop.
When they unloaded my truck, a good bit of the plastic from the headlight and grill fell out on the tow truck, And the driver just brushed it off into my yard where my truck was sitting. I didn't think much of it, I'd just clean it up in the morning when I went out to take pictures to start working with my insurance.
I talked to my insurance, They told me because it's a newer model truck,  That they would have someone from their salvage provider come pick it up, I believe it was 3 days later when I got a call from a lady from IIA or IAA, saying that she was about to be giving a driver the information to come pickup my truck and verified my address and the damages with me.
Not too terrible long after I spoke with her and said ok to having another tow truck company come out, Joey actually called me when he was roughly 30 minutes away from my home to verify my address and that everything was ready to go. He showed up just as he said and came to the door and got me to explain why he was there, And actually gave me the rundown on the process of what would happen if progressive did or did not total my truck. I handed off my keys to him, He went and got  his truck from the street and backed it in to where he'd be able to load it up. Before he backed up into the location, he did ask me if I had septic in the area (I I didn't)  He said he always asks when he has to enter a yard,  Said he's never had a problem with accidentally finding a tank but really didn't want to have to make phone calls explaining a problem!  LOL!
He got down under my truck and did his work with some chains, Put it in neutral to wind it up his truck and chain it down. Now, this is where I became surprised,  He picked up every piece of plastic and debris that had come from my truck and put them in the bed. I never asked him to!
I asked why he did and he said he wanted it to be just as if he and my injured truck were never there. I'm still amazed that there a people that have that mindset.
We talked for a few more minutes as he finished loading and chained my truck down, I asked where they were out of and he gave me a business card with everything on it. I'm in Chilton county, So it's not feasible for me to call a company that's an hour plus away,  But he told me that you have trucks all over the place at any given time, And to call if I needed help, That you might be right down the street!
As I said early on, I never thought that my best experience in this headache would have been the guy that picked up my truck and towed from my home to Progressive's auction yard. It ended up being totaled,  But I'm loving my new blue f150!
Thank you to Joey and Hank's!

resp.text: That is so amazing to hear, Brian! Thank you so much for taking the time to share your feedback with our team at Hank's Towing Service. It's great to know that we continue to provide our customers with everything they need. Have a great day!

name: Eden Snyder
text: For anyone considering calling this place for a tow, save your time and money and stay FAR away!! We have had not one, but TWO horrible experiences with this tow service. The first time, they left my 70 year old Father stranded in 90° weather for hours on end, we have AAA and they assigned Hank's to the tow job. They accepted the job and didn't call/notify/cancel the job to give my Dad the opportunity to get another company assigned to the job, they just left him stranded!!! Then, my husband called them last night and they accepted his request for a tow directly,no AAA,  he called them himself since they were close. They told him they would be there in no more than 45 minutes. 1 hour later, no word. He calls them back, they say they took another job and would get him as soon as they finished. 3 HOURS LATER, my husband is still stranded and calls them for the third time. They end up telling him he may be better off calling another company. God forbid what would have happened or how long my husband would have waited if leaving it up to them to follow up on a service they accepted to begin with. Y'all are clearly in the wrong business, and people can be seriously hurt or have personal things in their life that an be SEVERELY affected by your negligence and lack of consideration. Thank God they weren't on their way to work or something pressing that required a timely arrival. Lesson learned. I will be sure to let AAA know to never assign this business to my tow jobs again, and I would recommend the same to all of you, unless you want yourself and loved one's to be stuck out in the middle of the night with no help or in the blistering Alabama heat. Spread the word, Hank's is not a reliable service and should not be in the business they are!

Then upon my return the next day (of which I announced prior via phone call) to retrieve my personal belongings and work tools, he had a sheriff's deputy present in the parking lot, though no verbal or physical threat had been made.

name: Chanse LaShai
text:
Couple years back, brought in my vehicle and asked them to check over everything to make sure it would be good for a 1500 mile journey. They only took 30 minutes, topped my fluids, and sent me on my way with the all-clear. Went elsewhere for a second opinion and they were shocked that Gill's blatantly missed (or didn't even check) that I had some serious suspension issues as well as separating tires.

Fast forward to earlier this year. Boyfriend's new car had a clutch failure. Ordered a conversion kit online to do ourselves. After not being able to put it back together it was brought to Gill's. It turned out the company we ordered from sent us the wrong kit. Gill's said it would be a week or so. After hearing nothing, had to call and see where progress was, got some excuse about why it wasn't done yet. Okay, not a big deal but should have been kept up to date. Week after week of not being kept up to date, and hearing excuse after excuse as to why, 2 months later car is ready. Car feels great, except for a weird rumbling sensation that wasn't there before. Oh well, not sure what it is. Notice a bolt just sitting in the console that wasn't there before. Turns out they didn't even connect the steering column. Thank goodness it didn't give out and KILL US while driving down 280 for the week we couldn't figure out the rumbling/random bolt. Won't ever return, and will always warn people from here on out.

name: April Renfro
text: I purchased an engine from here, was guaranteed motor was good. Paid for it over the phone and picked it up the next day. After getting the motor in it was knocking called and talked to a lady who said owner wasn’t in and he’ll give me a call back, he never called me back. I called a couple days later and he answered I let him know what was going on and he said you only have a 30 day warranty, when in fact my paperwork states I had 60. Thank god I had kept the receipt. He told me I had to fill out the warranty paperwork and present receipts. Ok no problem but on the warranty form it states that the timing belt needs to be replaced, this engine has a chain. He informed me that regardless belt or chain it’s all the same. Well I got some news from you buddy there not, a chain shouldn’t have to be serviced under normal conditions, a belt yes I agree it does. But if the motor is knocking that has nothing to do with it. This is a fair warning for anyone purchasing from here he will not refund your money and will think of any way possible not too, and he uses the square app which makes things much harder to get a refund through your credit card. But I am happy to say after over 8 months I have received my refund and hope this guy flies out of business and really feels it. I tried to do the rite thing and not go through my card company but in the end they took care of it. And I really hope this guy goes out of business.

resp.text: Hi April.  We do not have a record of you ever purchasing anything with us.  We recommend that if any item is purchased from American Salvage and is under warranty that it be brought back to our location for inspection.

This is the last you will hear of me,  I have better things to do with my time, but I hope you will learn some humility and actually try and be polite to people for a change in the future.  Best of Luck!  ***  OH!!  ALSO  HOW DID YOU KNOW IT WAS THE 1996 BUICK SKYLARK?  WE HAVE NOT EVEN MENTIONED TO YOU ANYTHING ABOUT THE CATALYTIC CONVERTER MISSING? name: John Capps
text: Overpriced! I hydroplaned off the side of the highway and down a deep ditch, hitting the bank head-on. The police called Seamon to come pull the car out. I explained to the tow truck driver gave that I didn't have the money to pay to have it towed home, as it was my 2nd day of work at my new job. So he gave me the information I'd need so I would know where the car was being towed to, which was about a 10 minute drive from the scene of the accident. I called Seamon later that afternoon to inquire about how much it would cost to get out, and the lady said, "$180.00 today, plus $20 per day that it sits here. After 2 weeks, we claim it as an unclaimed/abandoned vehicle and that's an extra $75 plus the extra $20 per day, and to have the car taken to my house, it would have to be towed. And guess what that means: Another towing fee. I understand needing to run a business and having to charge fees, but that is absolutely ridiculous! The car isn't totalled, but because of their outrageously overpriced fees that I can't afford, I can't get it back or any of the new parts I recently put in it. Maybe it's just me, but those rates really make it sound like they take your car and make it unfairly impossible to get back before they part it out and/or junk/crush it. Makes me sick, and I will never willingly do business with them again.

PLEASE STAY AWAY FROM THIS COMPANY!!!!!!!

text: Thank you so much for your service tonight. While parking at the firework show downtown, we hit a hole and needed a wrench out. Twenty minutes later, we were headed home. Even under extremely unfavorable circumstances, the towman stayed professional and courteous, not to mention knowledgable. He handled the situation with caution and the utmost care for the safety of my vehicle. They have definitely won my future business.

name: Daniel Whitfield
text: Truck broke down on I65 north bound right outside of Prattville around 4:30pm. Only took 20 mins to arrive.Tommy towed my truck and trailer all the way to downtown Bham and charged an extremely fair price. Will use again.

name: Joe Kirby
text:
I am the owner of a franchise auto dealership. My sales manager was returning from vacation in a company owned Suburban and was rear ended by a vehicle going in excess of 100mph which caused the Suburban to flip on it's passenger side and then the roof and slide down the road till the headliner started to catch fire while the occupants were hanging upside down by their seatbelts, including his pregnant wife, who was understandably traumatized. It was impossible to retrieve personal items due to all the broken glass and by the time the wrecker had the vehicle right side up they were in route to the hospital. After being cleared from the Hospital they had to rent a car and then called Seamon Wrecker to come and get their clothes and work computer. The female dispatch person demanded to see a title to prove he owned the Suburban in order to let him have his personal belongings. This was not a release of the vehicle, only clothes and computer, both very easy to verify who the owners are, including the police report showing they had just been driving this vehicle. This being a company vehicle, the titles are in the company safe until sold and being after hours it is impossible to produce a title. As the owner of the company who owned the Suburban I called on behalf of my sales manager and tried to explain the situation, prove ownership, and authorize his retrieving his personal belongings. The female dispatch person was extremely abusive of the power she held, showing no interest to listen, help, or understand, comparing the situation to a person taking a car without paying for it which made no sense, and then hanging up on me. There is no job that justifies a person disregarding the humanity of others. It's one thing to ignore the wounded traveler on the side of the road and not help as the Samaritan did, but even in that parable no one went out of their way to kick the traveler. A innocent victim of a violent collision with a pregnant wife would elicit some degree of compassion from almost anyone, However, this person seemed to relish the abuse and hardship that was in her power to dish out. At this moment our salesmanager is driving home without his belongings, and hopefully will be able to retrieve them tomorrow. I will consider revising this review if there is any sign of helpfulness tomorrow as I have reached out by email to the company. So far the one person on duty displayed what can only be described as soulless behavior. She may be going through an extremely hard life herself but if her intent is to make everyone in her world miserable, she is succeeding.
UPDATE Saturday: No response to my email but with an abundance of paperwork, today my salesmanager was able to retrieve his belongings. He took a picture of a sign on the wall that said the attitude you display is the attitude you get back....ironic. The person on duty today was not the nightmare  that the woman last night was so for that I give 2 stars instead of one. The sad fact is no one looks at reviews for a wrecker company before calling one as it is usually an emergency so I'm sure this will do no harm but at least others who without a doubt are going to have horrible experiences with this company can know they are not crazy and they are not alone. We've all had about enough Seamon.

name: Ira Gordon
text:
After receiving a very steep quote from a competitive towing company, I called Tony's Towing Inc. and spoke to a woman. She said that both of the tow drivers were busy at the moment, but that she'd call to let me know when one was on the way.

A short time later (about 10 minutes or so), one of said drivers called me directly and let me know that he was about 15 minutes away, but that he was on the way. He arrived just as he said he would and got me loaded. While driving to my destination, he gave me an estimate that was surprisingly lower than the first company. He and I talked the entire way. When we reached my destination, he did some calculating and his original estimate was spot on. After lowering the car onto the driveway, he even helped me back the car into the carport. I wasn't able to compensate him for going above and beyond, but the least I could do is keep my word and write a review.

From start to finish, my experience with Tony's Towing Inc was great.

Ellis, if you're reading this, I enjoyed our conversation as well and appreciated the advice. Thank you for your service in your former fields. Stay safe out there, man.

name: Eli Gelsinger
text: Absolutely awful experience here. The service representative gave me an extremely difficult time trying to get my car out of repo. My car was clearly listed to have two buyers (me being the co-buyer). As I'm showing him my ID to show that I have the authority to withdraw my vehicle he has the nerve to lie and say that I'm not listed as a buyer. I told him countless times that there is paperwork in my car that can proove otherwise. He lied and said the paperwork wasn't in my car. After jumping through a goosehunt of obstacles. I finally get my car back and sure enough, the paperwork is in my car that shows i am the co-buyer. It's almost like these people get a thrill out of giving you a hard time.

resp.text: First, we don't repo.  Secondly, we must follow all strict guidelines as the laws requires (police give us the information).  It is no different than dealing with the courthouse or the license office, all paperwork must be correct and exact.   If we released vehicles to everyone that says "I am the owner", etc. we would have even more complaints.

name: J Laine Lucas
text: I worked all day on the day of the Christmas Day parade which starts at 7pm. There were no signs when I parked my car and where I parked that morning. I never left the office until I got off at 5:30 my car was towed. I walked to the tow lot which was in some backyard of a home and had to pay $125 for them to move my car a block (from the corner of the art center to behind soul bowls). I explained my situation and it landed on deaf ears. I work just like they do. To make a living for the holidays to provide for my loved ones, just like they do. But they exploit a contract with the city and told me that either the city would have to pay for it or I would. They in no way care who you are what your situation is or have any epthany. I reluctantly paid but will be taking my case to the City of Fairhope. Regardless I will have a better chance with the city than I will at Tony’s Towing. They do not care about you. I’ve had another experiece with them after I totaled my truck and while I was shaken up the police office on the scene called to have it towed for me. Tony’s showed up loaded up my truck and I asked how much it would be he said insurance has it covered. My insurance is liability only and did not cover the towing as he assumed. For them to tow the truck 1.6 miles it cost me $200. I had other options but when I explained this to them again they don’t care. If it’s ever a choice do not use them.  It’s December, it’s the holidays. Have some empathy for people. Stop Treating people like garbage.

resp.text:
First and foremost, I apologize for the super late reply.  I have just gotten the Google account working again.
Parade towing is something Tony’s Towing, Inc. has no control over.  The city makes all signage, they tell us which vehicles to tow individually, and through the city ordinance, they even tell us how much we can charge (which is actually less than it would be for a private property tow).  I understand your frustration, but the police had your vehicle towed, not us.  We are simply a tool exercised by the city.  The reason for the holding yard “in some backyard” is to provide a convenient place for you to pick up your vehicle.  Our main towing yard in across town, which would have cost you a taxi ride and made the experience even less desirable.
We are a very empathetic business and have been for nearly 30 years, but unfortunately if we did not charge every person that illegally parked because they have an excuse, we would be working for free.
Once again, I’m sorry for the predicament you were placed in, but Tony’s Towing, Inc. did not create, nor exploit your situation in anyway.  We simply did our job.

text: Tyler Huggins was amazing with the way he serviced my vehicle. I called this company for help with towing my vehicle to my home. Tyler told me it would be $75 and I agreed. He asked me what was wrong with my vehicle and I told him that antifreeze was leaking from under my car. He wanted to look for himself to see what was wrong. He lifted the hood and told me to try to start my vehicle. Before I could even start it, liquid was spraying out of a tube and he confirmed that it was gas that was leaking out. He told me that I can go to an auto shop to get it fixed. He gave me two choices whether to take to my vehicle to my house or take it to an auto shop for someone to fix. It was almost 6:00 p.m. so I told him that I would take it to an auto shop the next day and that he could take the vehicle to my house. Surprisingly, he offered to help fix the issue with my vehicle. I told him he didn't have to but he said he wanted to help. He towed the vehicle to an auto parts retailer where I purchased the parts that he needed for $3. Overall, he said that it would cost me $65 for him to do all of this instead of the $75 for just  towing the vehicle to my house. I told him that was so nice of him to do that for me and I thanked him for it.  He fixed the leaking issue with my vehicle and I offered to give him a $5 tip to go along with the $65 but he said it was my choice to give him a tip. I told I wanted to do it because he made my day by providing excellent service for me. My vehicle worked as if that issue never happened. I would strongly recommend this company for their services.

They had my car diagnosed and fixed within 45 minutes (I was expecting to be there for over an hour). They were very honest and professional, and not to mention their prices were very reasonable. I had my insurance company cancel the request and get another tow company who showed up within the estimated time and much more nicer to work with. Would not recommend.

name: Haley Phillips
text: If I could give this company no stars I would. After towing our truck out of a loading zone (which we were given permission to park in!) within 15 minutes of it being there, they then proceeded to tell us we could come get it for $250. Yeah that’s right, $250!! So we managed to finally figure out where our truck was they said we could get it the next day, just call beforehand because “they’re open 24 hours a day”. We called about 16 times within a 4 hour span with no answer. We finally got a hold of someone who told us he couldn’t let us get it right then because the guy in charge of that lot had decided to go see his girlfriend (???) and there wasn’t anyone to open it, but he could be there in an hour. So we waited. And waited. After an HOUR AND A HALF we finally called about 6 more times and still no answer. We have still yet to receive our truck nor hear ANYTHING. Extremely unprofessional and absolutely ridiculous behavior from a company.

And I'd say he businesses in Arlington probably split the cost or they would not care who parks at their location after they are closed.

name: Joel Iacono
text:
I recently had the unfortunate opportunity to need the services of a towing company for my disabled RV. Calling my Good Sams travel insurance, I was not involved or privileged to be in the selection process of a towing service company. It was very obvious to me that this insurance company wanted to make me feel that my road problems would be handled in a most professional manner by using A-1 and I was not let down.  The A-1 driver was prompt in coming to our rescue, friendly, curtious, and very knowledgeable about properly connecting and towing a very heavy expensive vehicle slowly and carefully. In addition, the vehicle was towed slowly and carefully to my home town mechanic over 35 miles, no questions asked.

Do not hesitate to call A-1, you will be very happy and well satisfied that you did. Remember, if a major insurance company uses A-1, they want me to be happy in a time of need and to continue purchasing the roadside assistance policy.

A-1 is the best in the area....

Several months went by, never heard from him anymore until I seen the review that was posted several months after we had spoke. I have tried to call several times and left messages for him to call me back, but no response. As far as the chipped and cracked interior parts, I have no explanation for them as we did not do any work to the inside of the vehicle. name: Ron Foster
text: I know no one ever want a car breakdown but it happens from time to time. Travelling southbound on I65, my left rear tire went flat quickly at Mile Marker 218.  With interstate traffic racing by, car heavily packed, no spare tire, and walking to the nearest exit not an option, I googled roadside assistance.  Billy Williams Towing is listed on top for a reason.  If ever a car failure in the area and roadside assistance is required, Billy is the one you want to come and help. Very quick response, friendly, and professional.

resp.text: Thanks Ron. I'm always happy to help. Stay safe out there.

name: Kristin Mullinix
text: Billy went above and beyond to help my family and I when we were in need. We were out of town, driving back from vacation. My car was overheating, so I pulled off the Jemison exit. My coolant reservoir had cracked. I wasn’t sure what we were going to do. Traffic was horrible and with it being late afternoon on a Saturday (the day before Easter), many places were closed. Billy saw our car with the hood up and came over to help. He told me which auto part store was open and gave me directions. He replaced the reservoir for me, and then triple and quadruple checked that my car was good to go before he felt safe enough for us to get back on the road. A few hours later he even texted us just to be sure we were ok and the car wasn’t getting hot again. I 100% recommend him!  He is definitely a God send and I appreciate what he did for us more than he will ever know!  Thanks again, from the bottom of my heart!

resp.text: You are very welcome! Stay safe out there and call me anytime!

name: Shayla Currie
text: I was traveling I-65 South bound with my two daughters and my tire went flat😬...and the traffic was so unforgiving! I didnt know where i was plus my spare was bad...I just knew i had just entered Chilton County...so i grabbed my phone and Google nearest tow service and Billy's Towing was the first to come up. Omg...i explained to him the last sign i remembered seeing andhe knew exactly where I was...he got to us REALLY quickly! He was fast, courteous, patient, and very kind. I was nervous and worried because I was stuck out on the interstate with my two girls but Billy made everything better..he even got my car to a tire shop that waited for us and got me a new tire on my car in no time. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS COMPANY!!!

resp.text: Thank's Shayla! Glad I could help you out!

text:
Fast, reliable, super friendly, definitely helped our family of 5 while stranded with a truck/boat. Went the extra mile for us and we are very appreciate. Highly recommend!
Keri

He brought our son and his car all the way to Eufaula, AL. He has great customer service and is a great person. Mr. Billy even took out the time when he got the car home, to do some trouble shooting to see what was going on. The Rogers family highly recommend Mr. Billy again and again. God bless.

text: Mr. Billy thank you sooooooo much for your service, me and my sister in law broke down on the side of the road and I called tow company they moved us to the next exit... so the lady did try and help but she left us where there was nothing around....but gas station no place to sleep or anything....a passerby stop and insisting us with help and contacted mr. billy and when I say he came in 30 mins he was there......he stay with us the whole 3 hours it took for the company I got my car from to pay him for towing, I was short on money I just had paid 85 for the first tow, then to find out my truck motor was locked and wasn’t drive able, I was scared but billy said not today him and his friends at NAPA auto parts and a customer helped us out with room and food...we was heading home to Kentucky, but we had to stay in Alabama over night Mr. Billy stayed with us until we found a hotel and he made sure we was safe, most tow company wouldn’t have done that....MR. BILLY YOU ARE A TRUE BLESSING, Thank god for you and keep that heart of gold.....

resp.text: Yolanda, I'm so glad that I was able to help get you taken care of. You call me anytime.

text:
Beware! This company is so crooked. They wont tell you what you are being charged (on purpose) then hold your vehicle hostage until u pay it. I asked the tow truck driver many questions he wouldn't answer any of them and refused to take my vehicle where I asked him to, only to his shop.  Clever, because the next day they informed me I get charged for 2 calendar days when they had the car for like 12 hours. $375 initially to tow it 1 mile to their shop!
Not only that! When I showed up to question them at their office they were super defensive rude and ready for a fight.
Also, heres a big one! After talking to the city I caught them charging more than their contract with the city of Pelham allows. They had to adjust the bill because they got caught in the act trying to charge me more. Wow! But they still got almost $700 out of me to tow a truck 1 mile from accident and store it. I didn't call them to tow it, the city police did!
It's not fair they get away with this.

text: They are in cohoots with the Alabama State Troopers only to find out I could not call AAA to then realize I had to pay $525.00 tow bill and $30.00 a day storage. Then when I went to retrieve vehicle was charged an additional 5% of $32.00 because I didn’t pay cash. This company will probably end up on American Greed one day. Definitely stay away and tell everyone else as well.

name: Margaret Atchley
text: Always nice and best prices around! If any of you on here would research before you bash a company you would not be posting such bad reviews. The prices  aren't set by the company but by the local Police Depts for wrecks and impounds.  Also the driver's have a very dangerous job and no amount of pay is worth the risk they take to come get you off the side of the road at all hours of the night with cars not getting over nor slowing down! This is someones son, father, husband or brother. You don't realize the time that is taken from their families to help someone  in need or someone that only thinks of themselves by drinking and driving! I understand that no one wants to let go of any of their money but you know sometime you have to do so it's called life! Before you post a bad review about a company stop and think don't just post out of anger.

name: Brittany Betros
text: I was in a single car accident and this company was called by the police to tow my car. I called them to see what I needed to do since I had never been in the situation before. The man on the line was extremely rude and did not want to answer any questions. Really made me feel stupid for asking anything. The car was totaled, they said he wouldn't accept the title due to the cost of scrap being low, told me to come settle the tow bill ($350 flat, plus $30 a day storage) and then I could take it where I wanted. The car is useless, I don't want it back. Here's a tip, Don't be rude to your customers!! I want absolutely nothing to do with them or their business.

name: tonit2112
text: I am visiting from NC and my mother recommended this place.  She says they have always been fair with her.  I asked them about my struts which Firestone had said I need to replace and they said No that I did not.  Also, they installed my after market back up camera and charged me less than other quotes I have gotten. He explained to me how he connected everything and ran the wires through the door, side back panel and then the headliner and connected to the sun roof power since I would not be operating both the sun roof and the reversing at the same time so as to not blow a fuse.  He showed me the limitations because of where my spare tire is positioned on the back of my RAV4 and the design of the camera to be connected to the license plate.  So it gives a bit of a blind spot and he wanted to make sure I was aware.  Anyway, all other quotes I had received where at least $75 more.  They did a great job and I am very pleased.

name: Sean Blasingame
text: Their were alot of older junk/wrecked  cars here. You can pull your own part or you can get them to pull it. The service is so so and expensive if you go there in person. They did charge what a dealership charges minus $5 an hour despite the fact noone was a certified mechanic at the time. It may be different now. Only good if you have a car circa 1990's and before. They do have some 2000's but limited stock. Prices vary drastically! Needed parts for a ford expedition approx 8 years ago. Told me it was $125.... A new one was $118 at auto zone! Got my friend to call (he recommended them) then and ask for the same part..He was told $40. Dress country or your prices are higher. Especially in a polo or shirt with button. Did this approx 6 times for different parts. Alternator, rotars(twice), muffler, coils and wires rearview mirror. My friend always got the best price_. Dressed in Dale Earnhardt shirt, old wrangler jeans i found at yardsale down the road. I went in person and got the same price my friend received. In polo shirt and khaki shorts, they multiplied the price by 3 or 4. The last time, in summer 2011, i needed another rotar i got a price over the phone talking country of $20. Went to pick it up dressed nice(normal for me), they told me i was given the wrong price and it would be $45. Never went back. I hope this is not the case anymore. Just wanted to share my experience.

name: Greimr XIII
text: Been there a few times. They don't let you out on the yard and try to sell you new parts. They didn't even tell me untill I was leaving that they didn't even have a vehicle like mine. And the lady sat there and lit up a cig in that tiny room. While I was asking about a part.

I highly recommend All Area Towing, but hopefully I won't need to use their services again lol.

text: Mr. Charles is freaking awesome.  I was headed to Alabama from Georgia and my back passenger tire was blown out.  He was very kind, patient and very helpful. Well, Mr. Charles saved the day . He called around until he found a spot that had the tire.  Needless to say he towed me there with a smile and we had a good conversation.  Thanks so much Mr. Charles.  I appreciate you.  Have a Merry Christmas!!!!

name: Drenen Tidwell
text: Absolutely a rip off. Was promised a 3 year warranty on the motor I purchased. Not only was it not a new motor it looks like they pulled it out of a junker out back. They called n said was ready to pick up drove an hour to get there they didn't have the decency to tell me that there was no longer a battery in the car but could sell me a used one for a hundred dollars. Plugged all vac lines off on carberator, n took the existing vac set up totally off the car, not even a year later changing antifreeze n find the thermostat is rusted so bad wouldn't open or close.fuel pump goes out right after that. Wouldn't believe that that kind of crooked business practice is still n play but I guess it takes all kinds. Especially if you are disabled and can't inspect the work before pick up. Hope this keeps others from suffering the same shotty workmanship.

name: Noah Estus
text: Only honest mechanic I know that will reduce the amount of work you need if you DONT need it. Also gives you great service at a discounted rate. Gary doesn’t take advantage of anyone, and tries to provide great work. I would not trust anyone else with my car.

name: Jaimee Tubbs
text: Ive had several things fixed by him, fuel pump brakes, uv joint, they always tell u the price before they fix and call if something else needs worked on. Ive had a mechanic fix things and charge me for things I didn't ask for and still had to pay!...all around very good people.

name: Sue Odom
text: Great folks would have cost me $4000 at a dealership to get my brake system fixed. My Toyota 4 runner is fixed and running great for a quarter of that.

text: Nate D. Is awesome! Very friendly and extremely professional. He went above and beyond to assure my safety as well as towing my vehicle to a convenient location for me. I would recommend his services at any time! I am so appreciative of him going above just towing my vehicle he made me feel safe and made my LO comfortable during our tow. Thanks Nate!

name: Jason Horton
text:
My grapple truck broke down only 2 miles from where it was going. I called pro tow and they gave me a price of what it should be to go that short distance. After they delivered the truck they told me it would be 487.00.
I will not be using this company ever again.
I’ve never been charged that much for such a short distance. It’s rediculous!!!

name: Angela Mulkin
text: The lady was very nice and went out of her way to help me

name: Jordan
text:
The staff was great. I called and dispatch was positive and forthcoming with rates and expectations to when my vehicle would be picked up. I was able to speak with the drivers and coordinate a pickup time. Upon arrival the guys were really friendly and positive. I found this to be comforting considering my mind was concerned on pending mechanic bills. Once the guys had me hooked up I called back in and payment was accepted over the phone. I hope I never need them again however I’ll know who to call if I do.

Thanks! - Jordan

name: Ben Turner
text: Great experience on Saturday with this company. Had to pick up on I-65 and the driver was extremely helpful and informative on the best way to get our vehicle safely onto his truck and off the highway. Highly recommend this company.

text: Super high on rates and wouldn't let me get my insurance info out of my car so I could get a release to pick it up it was only there 36 hours it cost 300 dollars to get it absolutely highway robbery

name: Victor Olivas
text: Joseph was very nice and helpful.

name: Pam Norris
text: Very professional, came to tow my truck in a reasonable time frame. Reasonable towing fee!

name: Craig
text: I had a great experience with this service!!! My car wasn’t running right which already put me in a bad mood but when I called, the driver called me back shortly and told me he was on the way. When he got there (George) he was very polite and did not overcharge me at all, like some of the other reviews I’ve read. Then he took it to the dealership and dropped it off and gave them the keys and everything they needed to contact me all without me ever having to go up there. Great service and I will definitely be using them every single time if this is the kind of service they continue to offer! They definitely lived up to their professional name, in my opinion.

name: Shantele mccarter
text: Very respectful and professional workers. makes you feel like you couldn't have went to no better place. I would recommend this place 100%

text: Mannnn Nate D. Is the best. Very professional and understanding. I was in a bad mood, I got rained on. JUST A HOT MESS TBH. But Nate came right on time and quick I probably wasn’t even waiting ten minutes. I’m going to make sure that I refer as much as possible. Thank you NATEEEEE D.

text: Driver started my car and avoided tow. Thanks!

name: Lyric Brogden
text: George arrived to my vehicle in less than 15 minutes (before I did) and was friendly and professional.  I was parked in a weird spot, but it didn’t take him long to maneuver around and get my car loaded up and we were on the way.  I found his manner nice, he did a great job for me and the price was reasonable.  I recommend without any reservations.

text: Got into a minor accident at the entrance of the subdivision where I live. Pro-tow tried to charge me $375 to bring my car to my drive way. I understand making money but that is a complete crook behavior.

text: My Tahoe was stranded in a parking lot in Bluff Park and wouldn't start. I needed a short tow to my house in Homewood where I could work on it. George called to let me know he was on the way. He was very pleasant, good sense of humor, professional, and did good job. He unloaded my vehicle perfectly in my driveway. I couldn't ask for a better transaction. Thanks George.

name: TAMEKA DIXON
text: Nate D. #93 was great to work with during such a tense and scary time.

name: Tommy Goodridge
text: I had a great experience with Pro-Tow! They were very prompt and professional. I encourage that they be used for all towing needs. Many thanks go to Mica, he is very respectful I consider him a good friend. He even invited me to his church! How great is that. They are my best towing experience thus far.

(We live in Pelham and were driving home from T-town when it happened.) Called AAA and a couple of other companies close to where we were broke down before calling them and no one could help. They'll be the first call next time. Thank you so much!!

name: dexter leigeber
text: They were prompt and the driver was very courteous. Handled it all over the phone saving me a 120 mile round trip.

text: Scott and Joe have pretty much saved me an my business these last few days. Timely, efficient, great customer service, and excellent price. To say that we’re grateful for them would be an understatement. Glad we’re able to work with this excellent team.

One of the biggest rackets I have encountered.   Tried going in today to plead with them but the manager wasn't hearing any of it, even scoffed at me when I wanted a copy of the release report back, like I am the criminal.

They tell me the owner has to send in a letter stating that they’re able to release the car to me and any damages to the car after leaving their garage has nothing to do with them. Understandable. Why when I finally get to see my car the bumper is hanging off, the tire axle is broken, and the driver’s door is unable to open fully. This place is a joke, completely unprofessional.

resp.text: NO MA'AM THIS IS NOT CORRECT.  WHEN YOUR CAR IS IMPOUND BY HUNTSVILLE POLICE DEPARTMENT THE CONDITION IS NOTED BY THE POLICE OFFICER BEFORE WE PICK UP THE VEHICLE. WE DO AS OUR CONTRACT READS WITH THE CITY.

text: I did not use this towing company intentionally. I was unfortunate enough to have parked in a lot where I did not see a no parking sign posted and they towed me. As a result of their towing I'm having to do a minimum of $900 worth of work to my vehicle so I'm not very pleased with them at all. When I arrived to claim my vehicle, because they had towed it just before midnight and I picked it up just after midnight, they charged me 2 days worth of storage on top of the fine. After this experience, I cannot think of any reason why I would call this company to tow a vehicle of mine when there are so many other good options.

text: My car got impounded because the guy driving was doing illegal stuff. But these guys were great. No hassels low cost and very nice. Thanks Roadside.

resp.text: THANK YOU FOR YOUR REVIEW.

text: Completely unprofessional!! When we arrived to the guy at the front was had his shoes off and was laying in two chairs sleeping. Knocked on the window numerous tomes and it took forever for him to wake up. Once he finally woke up he not once apologized and told us he couldn’t help us that we had to wait on the lady to get back. Once she got back she was on a personal phone call while  trying to assist us even though  there is a sign that says “We will be glad to assist you when you’re done with your personal  call”Very unprofessional and extremely disappointed!!!!

text: I reported them to the BBB and they told them they would sue me. I reported them to the Attorney General. They charged me $55 when Huntsville police said the fee was $35. I went to Lieutenant Johnson and he didn't know why? Huntsville police should never partner with crooks. BBB didn't want to give them an F. Don't use them.

resp.text: OUR PRICES ARE IN A CONTRACT WITH HPD AND WE CHARGE ACCORDINGLY TO THAT.
