text: Very rude ppl. & They charge for every little thing...

name: Marco Watson
text: They Showed up right on time, very professional the tow driver did an outstanding job getting my broken vehicle on his tow truck. The steering column on my crown vic was broken and it was parked in a small neighbor hood street cars everywhere I pre ordered the tow it worked like clock work and the price was outstanding. I recommend this company to anyone especially if you have a business and are looking to recover cars or move them a lot they are the ones to do business with. OUTSTANDING!

resp.text: THANK YOU FOR THE REVIEW.  WE APPRECIATE YOUR BUSINESS.

name: Tim Samples
text: My car was stolen from my apartment complex. It was recovered and impounded at roadside towing, These people have NO compassion for others, I was charged $205 to get my stolen car from them. Staff very unfriendly, I was driven to the back of the loyy to get my car, it had 2 flat tires and I was not even allowed to change the tires. I had to drive my car with flat tires outside the gate before doing anything to it. I just hope this same faith don't get them one day but if it does then they deserve it because of how they treat other people.

name: Patricia Jeffrey
text: Always have had excellent service with Roadside Towing. Timely and efficient.

resp.text: THANK YOU FOR YOUR REVIEW.

name: Sonja Beard
text: Our truck was impounded from a lot with “ no parking” signs barely visible. We had dinner at Moe’s BBQ and were there less than an hour. We phoned the number on the sign at the lot and were told by Walter that we could only get our vehicle out by paying $185 cash. We Ubered to the location after getting $200 in cash from the atm, only to be told that they had no change. A cash only business should be able to make change. We were then told by Walter and his coworker that my husband and I could not ride together to get our truck. We advised them that we would not be separated. We rode with the driver (he didn’t wear a mask, which is a COVID-19 violation) while he drove in reverse the entire way to get our truck. We were then cursed at when we expressed how irritated we were with the the situation and their customer service. While I understand they “have a contract” with the parking lot we mistakenly parked in, they obviously enjoy taking advantage of out of towners. Sadly, we won’t be spending any future tourist dollars in Huntsville after this experience.

name: Dave K
text: People were friendly and quick.. The place  was about what you expect. Wouldn't want to be there after dark.

text: Towed and impounded my vehicle from a parking lot with "no parking signs" barely visible. The driver made me pay cash and ride in flatbed truck cab to the back of the impound lot to get my vehicle and would not let me walk. As a woman this is very scary and also a COVID-19 violation, as we could not remain 6 feet apart in the truck cab and he was not wearing a mask. I have contacted TV Investigative Reporters and City Officials in hopes of putting a stop to these unethical business practices.

name: JED PERKS
text: These people are lowlife scam artists! I parked my tractor trailer in haysland and Hamilton Shopping Center parking lot, because there's no truck stop in Huntsville. I'm only home every other weekend and they didn't even have the decency to try to contact anybody and ask to move the truck. I didn't see any no parking signs anywhere and when I went to get  out of impound I said to the the guy at the desk, I guess the owner, I said there's not any no parking signs there! He said "oh yes there is, WE'RE THE ONES THAT MADE THEM AND PUT THEM THERE!! It's that even legal?.. So they are in cahoots with the property manager or owner of Hayesland and Hamilton. I went back the next time I was in town to look for these signs and they're so small you can barely see em. They are maybe 1x1 ft! If these are the kind of people that work there and own the place, I will never use their service and I recommend everyone else don't do business with them either. Oh and not only that but it COST ME CLOSE TO $300 to tow it maybe 10 miles! I ALMOST LOST MY JOB!! My company said if it happens again or if I were to work for any other trucking company I would have lost my job over these scam artists.... Ever heard of karma??.....

name: Denise Osullivan
text: I can never express how awesome this company is! I had a really difficult predicament and starting making phones calls as soon as I can to get a very difficult piece of equipment moved. The 1st call I made was to a really big company who I knew had the equipment to do this job for me,they completely turned it down. Second call was to Roadside . I spoke to the owner of the company Bobby Hall, after hearing the situation , he didn't  turn it down , instead he asked where the equipment was and he drove out of his way to go take a look at it. Bobby Hall went above and beyond the call of duty for me in this situation and kept me informed of everything that was going on from start to finish. I can't give enough praise to him and his guys for getting this done . Thank you thank you thank you is all I can say! All the best to you Bobby!! Denise

name: Michelle Evans
text:
Father and Son and Grandson.   They all were the perfect southern gentlemen.
First a little backstory...
We'd been left holding the bag.  From out of state, we'd arranged to purchase and have a shed towed 75 miles away.   The man we'd pre-arranged to pick it up who had already come and seen the job, priced it high...but didn't show at the time/date he had picked!  The company he'd sent in his place just hemmed and hawed about how it couldn't be done, the third company came and joined the chorus of I can't for this reason or that.
Then... we called Roadside Towing in Huntsville, AL.  They just came and did the job.  No complaining, no excuses, just plain hard work.  I highly recommend this family team.  They Will Get it DONE!

name: Ileah Pope
text:
From my experience, Roadside Towing & Collision is a horrible business.

One of their employees, by the last name of Bishop, put my car on the back of his truck at the scene of the accident, claiming he was only doing so to move it out of the way to gain access to the car he actually came to get.

After loading it, his story changed. He refused to put my car down, despite the fact that I had already called Triple A & they were on the way to come get my car.
He continued to say that as long as I came to the lot to pick my car up within 24 hours, it was free of charge.
I called the business, once I got home, and the man that I spoke with(who claimed to be the owner) had, again, a different story. Once he started to inform me of the charges to get my car back, I told him that his employee said it would be free until the end of the 24 hour day. He called his employee on 3 way, and Mr. Bishop lied, once again, saying he properly informed me of the charges.
After asking for his name as well, the man I was speaking with gave me the name "Jack Ass."  That was his second time cursing at me through out the conversation, the first being him telling me I needed to "hop my ass in a car and come get my car."
From another source, I learned that the owner's name is James Bepew. I'm unsure if the man that I spoke with actually was James Bepew, but one thing is for sure: this company was by far the worst in any category that I've ever come across.

name: Stephen Scohy

text: My car was towed from a private property while I was at work at the Huntsville Hospital. I called tow pro to verify that my car was there around 6:20pm at which the off site rep(a woman) quoted me $200. I was forced to wait until I got off at 10:00pm and arrived at tow pro at 10:30pm. Upon arrival I was met with the truck driver who was already there working. I called the off site rep to tell her of my arrival which she then charged me an additional $50 “gate fee(a fee charged to have a worker open the gate for me after hours) totaling $250. I disputed the charge informing her that a worker was already there and that there should be no need to charge me extra. I was forced to pay the $250 after being explained that they will continue to charge me day by day additional storage fees. While paying the over priced fee of $250 I asked the worked to explain to me their price point and simple inquiries about the price and regulations of towing companies, he then threatened me with addition storage fees for asking question stating that “the reason they charge so much for retrieving impounded cars is for people like me who get agitated and ask questions.” I was forced to essentially keep my mouth closed for fear of not getting my car back without having additional fees added. He did not provide me with information of their prices and refused to Itemize my receipt. I feel over charged by far and belittled having to pay for a Nonconsensual Towing fee without an explanation of prices.

name: Jevon Reinke
text: If you hire Simpson's Collision Repair and Wrecker Service you may run into frustrating circumstances regarding storage fees. Even more so on weekends, as they are only there for limited hours on Saturday and Sunday, and then only on the third weekend of every month. They assess a full day storage fee of $25 regardless of them being present at their impound lot to release a vehicle. They also state that it is their right to charge a full day of storage if they bring your vehicle to their lot before 12 am on any day. So if they tow it at 10 pm and get to the lot at 11:00 pm, it is their right to charge your tow fee and a full day of storage for that evening, as well as a full day of storage for the next day, even if you are there the second they open. So for example, if they tow your property 6.8 miles on a Friday evening, you can expect a $150 tow fee and multiple days of storage fees, when you can't even get it on most Saturdays or Sundays. Even if they are there on a Saturday or Sunday, sometimes they don't inform their answering service. This situation happened to me, though they only charged me for 2 days of storage. They informed me of this information and these policies while indicating I was lucky, because they could have made it worse. Just understand their tow policies before you hire them to recover your vehicle. In my situation, they towed my stolen motorcycle after a thief wrecked it, subsequent to a police pursuit. This is not a scathing review, and they to the best of my knowledge did a great job towing.

text:
My daughters '05 CR-V had a possible battery-drain/Charging system issue. Battery was dead after the car was sitting for 5 days. She got a jump and headed to Advanced-Auto. They replaced the battery (it needed to be replaced anyway) and then they did a charging system check - inconclusive...it *may* be the alternator .

This is when we  found Whitt's  - they confirmed it was not the charging system but rather a parasitic load on the system,  a 0.6A draw killed her battery over 5 days.  Whitt's found the offending culprit and we were out the door for less than $60.   Very pleased with their service.

I was advised to let it stay there until the insurance adjuster looked at it. Well, she falsified the police report and didn't have insurance. I still had to pay to get my car from them. $460 for it to be there a week today. $35 a day plus the initial tow fee and gate fee.
Then when I went to pick it up, they couldn't find the key to it. Tried to say we took it with us that night. Finally, they found it in their rollback after about 30 minutes of looking for it. A place of business needs to be better organized when dealing with other people's property. Also, if their employees don't know the rules, they don't need to be giving advice on what they will or will not do.

While I let my car cool, I called around to the auto shops to try to get an idea on prices and to tell them I was on my way because it was nearing 5 when everyone would be closing.
Once I arrived at Arnold’s auto repair I explained to the mechanic, Clark, what had happened and he listened through me freaking out. He got my car to where I could get safely back to Chattanooga and they were a lot cheaper than everywhere else I called. If I lived in Scottsboro I would definitely send everyone their way. Fair pricing and amazing service. ❤️❤️❤️

text: I’m a 22 year old girl from Texas. My car broke down a few miles out of Tuscaloosa while I was on my way to Atlanta to visit family in Georgia. Bambarger came to the rescue thankfully. The gentleman who towed me, his name was Blake, was so incredibly kind. He even went the extra mile to take me to a hotel, help carry my things inside, and make sure I was safe. This dude is seriously my hero, and he’s one of the kindest people I’ve ever met. He even made sure my car was towed to a place that serviced on the weekend because the insurance company we going to send it somewhere that was closed. Can’t express how thankful I am.
